website_summaries.verdict: Ecobee's SmartThermostat is a solid device that's well worth considering if you want a connected thermostat with a built-in Alexa speaker.
pros: The Ecobee SmartThermostat adds features to its built-in Alexa speaker
It has a redesigned temperature sensor and works with Google Assistant and Siri -- all for the same $249 price
cons: Depending on where your thermostat is located in your home, it might not be in an ideal place for an Alexa speaker

customer_reviews.title: Super easy
customer_reviews.text: I have an older home with a Goodman split AC unit. The old thermostat didn't have a C wire installed, but the provision was there in the wire harness. I thought that I might have to install the PEK unit, but after a little research on my air handler unit, and I located the C terminal on the air handler control board. I ran the spare blue wire in the thermostat harness to the C terminal on the air handler, and the other end to the C terminal on the ecobee. Viola! It all works flawlessly. If you take your time and research your system, install is simple.
customer_reviews.author: John-David

customer_reviews.title: No variable speed furnace fan support.
customer_reviews.text: This thermostat does not support variable speed speed fans. I run my fan constantly at a low speed to circulate and filter the air in my home. I bought this on prime day but didn't install it until October so I'm stuck with it. Partially my fault but I wish they would have include it in the description. Of course tech support supposedly hasn't had anyone complain so the didn't offer a refund. Lesson learned. I hope this helps future buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Gary P.

customer_reviews.title: Smart device, terrible thermostat
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, but this product was a serious disappointment considering its price and hype. After installation, which was fairly easy, I had to define my comfort settings (desired temp). However, despite the configurations I get low temp. warnings. A thermostat should know that if you are below desired temp. to turn on. But for whatever reason, this device is not. I had a Nest before and it proved itself as a 'Smart Thermostat', but I like to test new products and this was an ultimate let down. The only thing that works is the embedded speaker with Spotify.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Lugo

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: After installing the ecobee device (which was significantly harder compared to the Nest installation), the device would show the ecobee logo during boot and simply restart after about 30secs. During a 1h phone call with support, they couldn't figure out what was wrong. The wiring was seemingly correct and they couldn't diagnose if remotely if the unit or the powerkit was broken. Sent it back. What a pity, I would have loved to replace my old Nest with this, since Nest is shutting down their developer API/works with Nest program.
customer_reviews.author: dts

customer_reviews.title: Practically identical to Ecobee4...horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. No improvements in sound/speaker. Still cannot use with Alexa's Everywhere Groups. Most annoying, just like Ecobee4, Alexa constantly gives error message saying "Sorry, I am having difficulties completing your request, please try again later" for no reason at all...sometimes even when no one's even talking to it. I can only hope Ecobee6 will be much more improved.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermostat as expected!
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Ecobee 3 since it came out basically and figured it was time to upgrade to the new one. The newest Ecobee is great. Install was a breeze, the interface runs faster, the new temp senors look and perform great, and the addition of the glass front just tops it all off. I am really glad I made the jump to the newest version. Forgot to mention I can now yell at my thermostat to change the temp (or just ask it too). I have always had a really good and positive experience with Ecobee and their support. The Ecobee always comes highly recommended from me!
customer_reviews.author: erik nelson

customer_reviews.title: A few dealbreakers absolutely spoil an otherwise acceptable product
customer_reviews.text: 1. Alexa integration. No one should use Alexa integration. Alexa is the worst consumer product ever released. Speaking direct commands has a 15% rate of success. Stopping playback requires pulling the unit out of the wall. Alexa is worse than useless. 2. Requires a password for login. Who uses passwords anymore? What this means is that every time the app updates on your phone you'll need to go through password reset and enter it into everyone's phone by hand. This boneheaded product design mistake is not excusable in 2020.
customer_reviews.author: ChefBean

customer_reviews.title: Not so smart Thermostat
customer_reviews.text: If you just need a Thermostat this will do the job and do it well, if you want it to automate stuff by temperature this is not what you want. Alexa app does not see this as a device that can initiate a routine. while it has a temperature sensor it will not use it for automation. IFTTT looked promising but ultimately failed to control smart outlets by temperature and IFTTT doesn't recognize the smart sensors at all for "if" triggers. Sadly I will be packing up and returning as I expected a device with alexa built in to be more useful with alexa
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The installation was difficult and it ended up blowing a fuse and problems getting the AC compressor to restart, which led to a $250 visit from the HVAC company to fix and install. Hence the one-star review.
customer_reviews.author: Noyb

customer_reviews.title: WFH made me do it
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. If you set it up right you can just forget about it and let it do all the work. Also if you’re like me and often forget to turn off the ac/heat when you leave the house, you can just do it remotely. There’s a 5 degree temp differential between my living room and bedroom and the extra room sensor is helpful so at night it’s cooling/heating based on my actual room temperature not based on the warmer living room. I’d say the ecobee is definitely one of those purchases that I put off making because I can’t justify the cost but then I’m super glad I did it because it just works so well.
customer_reviews.author: mash

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: During a remodel we needed to get a new thermostat. At first I was a bit nervous upgrading to this system because we are not “Techy” inclined. I was so surprised on how easy this was to get use to! Even my parents who are in their late 70’s cane over and tried it out and had no issues! We love it! We have all of our gadgets linked to the system and truly have a blast with the Alexa feature! So far, we are thrilled with our purchase. During set up, the customer support was too notch and it was easy t install and the support person was with us every step of the way!
customer_reviews.author: Emmy

customer_reviews.title: Easy Easy Easy
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking at multiple units trying to figure out which on to buy, then stop and buy this one. The unit comes with everything you need to get going, including a back plate. The instructions are almost full proof. Labels for the old wires are included so there can't be any mistakes. The sensor works great, and can be used in tandem or as the main temperature reader if you so desire. This is definitely worth the money. Only thing I don't like is the added Alexa. I have one already downstair, so they battle each other for my attention. Easy fix though, just turn her mic off.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Best thermostat on the market
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it all depends on your house design, but switching over to the Ecobee smart thermostat with 3 additional Smart Sensors has made the biggest difference in our house. We have a split level that's actually 4 levels so having the thermostat read only the main level didn't help us anywhere else and in the winter it would just run and run. Placing the sensors on each level the whole house feels a constant temperature and it's so well regulated. I can't express how much better the temp is controlled with this setup. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good, if you don’t need tech support
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, except I haven’t been able to get in touch with their technical support for over a week. I have tried by email, via phone and thru ecobee/amazon technical support (which is not only useless but they will give you wrong information). For me, I’m still having issues with the “Away” mode that doesn’t appear to be working, and also not able to sign up with the eco program to get a discount from my energy provider. I will update this review later after and if I hear back from their tech support.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware. Broken after less than 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in 9/25/19 and installed within 2 weeks in our new home so that it would be compatible with all of our other amazon smart home products. Received a notification this morning, 1/18/20 that the internal sensor is broken and the item needs to be replaced. The window to return this Amazon product was only 30 days so now I’m stuck with a broken item that wasn’t cheap. Amazon support was of no help considering this is an Amazon product. Told me to call the manufacturer. Gee thanks. I should have just bought the Nest.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Works!  REAL customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this from Amazon and set it up. Went to the Ecobee website for assistance - sent in an email with a photo of my previous thermostat (an old round Honeywell) and with two hours received a response with a wiring diagram! When I was installing it had a minor issue and their help line was patient and stepped me through resolving my problem. I can now access my thermostat from anyplace I have a cell signal and change the temperature! The Alexa app on the thermostat works great as well. Overall a great product with excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd Ecobee - love it
customer_reviews.text: My utility company provided a free Ecobee Lite and I liked it so much that I bought this unit for my 2nd of 3 HVAC sysyems. My thermostats did not already have a C wire, so I made use of the PEK (Power Expansion Kit) to get my Ecobees installed. Once installed the units are very easy to program and use. I like app.beestat.io to obtain more detailed system info. I may not use the voice controls, but the included Smart Sensor was handy for me as I could place it in an adjacent room that's never quite the same temp as that in which the tstat is installed.
customer_reviews.author: norske

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite purchase for the home.
customer_reviews.text: The most versatile thermostat. Installation steps were very clear. I have work in low voltage for years and knew I could do it myself. Eventually I realized I had a complicated system installed prior so I had to call Tech support for some help. They could not have been more helpful. The agent gave me his email address to send him photos on issues I was having and he was able to solve it over the phone. The ability to set schedules and change settings from the app is very helpful when upstairs. The additional room sensor is exactly what we needed to cool our bedroom off when we are in there. Highly recommend to all friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: amerg

customer_reviews.title: Would Definitely Recommend this Product
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn’t have the “C” wire, so I had to install it myself and wire it in with the central unit. However, the instructions were very clear, and even came with wire labels so one does not get confused. It was an easy install for someone with technical experience, but I’m sure the average person could figure it out. I love the functionality of this thermostat, and love the customizable features such as setting the thermostat as away, sleeping, etc. I would very much recommend this product to anyone looking to save a little per month on energy costs, or just to simply take a step in the direction for a smart home.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Pros & Cons
customer_reviews.text: Nice thermostat, pretty easy to install. We did have a quirky issue with the thermostat not responding to the 'occupied' room and activating the heat. We contacted support, but response was very slow (took a few days). After a day the Eco Bee seemed to have self corrected. I am not seeing the cost savings, but just the opposite with the smart settings every time I enter the premise for lunch it turns on. Then runs 2 hours before it switches back to AWAY mode. You should be able to adjust the time settings
customer_reviews.author: Landscaper

customer_reviews.title: Ecobee continues to improve on a great product
customer_reviews.text: The latest Ecobee thermostat has gradually improved upon the original design and premise of what a thermostat can bee (pun). The functionality of Alexa rivals Amazon's own devices and everything just works as it should. They continue to innovate with features and functionality that categorical transforms your thermostat into an integral part of your smart home. The updated smart sensor is much more stylish and less utilitarian and adds a host of additional features. The speaker is surprisingly robust and capable of more than just interacting with Alexa. I have not fully tested spotify or voice calls yet, but I do not doubt sound quality will not be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Easy to install. I used the power injector, then wired up a C wire. Both installations work fine. One note of caution, though, is if you have an older furnace/controller board, it may not like working with the Ecobee. My controller board worked flawlessly with my original thermostat, but not with the Ecobee. Ecobee's support is great (they had me wire the C wire), but we could find no issue with the Ecobee itself. I finally decided to replace the controller board (mine was 22 years old) and the Ecobee and furnace now work seamlessly.
customer_reviews.author: GL1800

customer_reviews.title: Great thermostat - Worthless sensor
customer_reviews.text: I like the thermostat and it’s connection to my mobile devices. I love the graphic display that is downloaded to the iPad, though it takes too long to load, can’t be saved and is a pain to scroll back thru older data. The remote sensor is absolutely worthless. The product claims 5 year battery life. In real life it gets 6-10 days. I’ve contacted tech support but haven’t heard back. If you look at low ratings for the sensor device you’ll see that this isn’t a one-off lemon. It’s a faulty design.
customer_reviews.author: B. A. Thomasson

customer_reviews.title: Check compatibility before buying, it's not compatible with many modern high-efficiency systems
customer_reviews.text: The advertising for this product briefly states down in the fine print, "Compatible with most HVAC systems...Visit ecobee.com/compatibility for details." I suppose if "most" means "over 50%", that's probably true. But there are a LOT of high-efficiency systems out there which use proprietary thermostat controls to achieve their efficiency, in excess of any gains one might receive from this "smart" thermostat. I failed to check compatibility with mine, and although returning it to Amazon was free and just as easy as always, it was still a bit of a waste of time. Better highlighting the need to check compatibility in the long, photo-heavy product description would be of benefit.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Superb Product for ecobee...once again!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased, installed, and sold MANY ecobee products over the past 10 year. I'd have to say their unwavering product, innovative design, and 5-star support keeps me coming back as a customer and HVAC contractor. I have seen less failure in the ecobee product line compared to unnamed competitors and their setup keeps getting easier with each revision. The newly design sensor is really clean & functional, I love it! In closing: I'M A BIG FAN!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great help from Ecobee, easy install!
customer_reviews.text: While researching this thermostat I ran across the Ecobee compatibility checker which said they needed to take a closer look. I sent info to Ecobee, they answered within a couple days with info on how to connect wires without using the PEK (no "C" wire). I then went to local big box to purchase. During heating season I need to shut down my compressor, the associate said can't be done with this thermostat. Emailed Ecobee again and they told me exactly how to do that. I am a retired woman and usually hire professionals for home improvements.. not this time, this was an easy install and set up!
customer_reviews.author: premablue

customer_reviews.title: Out with the Nest and in with Ecobee!
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and lots of features. Love the built in Amazon Alexa and room sensors. This replaced our 1st generation Nest thermostat and were definitely not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Steven lewis

customer_reviews.title: A great smart thermostat
customer_reviews.text: We installed a new A/C and Furnace and decided to upgrade the thermostat as well. We looked at both the Nest and Ecobee but the reviews were heavily on the side of Ecobee. I am very happy with the decision. It was easy to install and integrated with Alexa flawlessly. We have total control over the system now whether home or away and it is a great product. It is not cheap at over $200 but when you figure what a brand new HVAC system costs why in the world would you skimp on the object that controls that very expensive system? It also looks great on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: wwrrmm1953

customer_reviews.title: Remote Sensors with Occupancy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Smart Thermostat! Had a difficult time replacing 2 wire thermostat wire with 4 wire, so just installed the thermostat in the basement. I put the remote sensor in the room where the thermostat was. I ordered 2 more sensors for the upstairs bedrooms, now my new AC has 4 locations to determine when to turn on, and checks for occupancy as well. Love, love, love this thermostat!
customer_reviews.author: Merijeen

customer_reviews.title: Infuriating complicated, harder to use than traditional thermostat.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had not got this. I wanted Nest but CNET said this was the best. Maybe if you want to get a PHD in how the app operates, it is great. But it is unintuitive, really hard to figure out how to turn on, on the device OR on the app. It’s actually harder to use than the old thermostat. How hard is it to have a “on” button and just up and down arrows. Can even get the basics write. And Alexa won’t connect and the troubleshooting doesn’t cover the use case. I wish I had got the Nest and now I shall return this and get the Nest.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Over Here the II

customer_reviews.title: You need to know your furnace or it will take a long time with frustration
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have a new furnace, you'll have trouble. My control board looked nothing like any videos I found. I eventually called Ecobee's customer support and, after a long hold, I was helped by a very nice, patient man. He was very knowledgeable and patient with me. He walked me through every step to connect my constant power source wire. If I knew what to look for, yes it would've taken me 30 min. Since I had no idea, it took almost 4 hours. Once installed, it's very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Hazelwood

customer_reviews.title: A thermostat with personality.
customer_reviews.text: I was wary about having a thermostat with Alexa but I love it. My former thermostat was a plastic box on the wall. How boring. Now my thermostat can talk to me. It tells me the news and let’s me know when my favorite football team is playing. It plays games with me. It wakes me up to any song I request. Amazing. It also adjusts the temperature just by asking. No need to touch it. I love that I can control the thermostat with my phone. I can monitor my thermostat while on vacation and adjust my home temperature right when my plane lands. Most of all, an ordinary thermostat has become my friend.
customer_reviews.author: Fanny A.

customer_reviews.title: Newest ecobee thermostat
customer_reviews.text: Works great, seems to do better than my first gen ecobee. Comes with a free room sensor (extremely easy to install). Ecobee was easy to install, but I had more than enough wires present. Had to call ecobee on how to reintegrate my whole home humidifier, and i am still amazed on how helpful they were. They even insisted on staying on the line to make sure my 3 room sensors were installed correctly. They had me email pictures of my install to make sure everything was correct; then reviewed the sent pictures in real time. Very helpful and professional; without being condescending in anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: This device was professionally installed. From what I saw, connecting wires to the device, also to my furnace, I wouldn't feel comfortable installing myself and glad they did. The device works as expected, ease of use from my phone or Alexa. I can also set the device from time away so the use of electricity is limited. There was a time when I called support, this is issue was diagnosed and determined to be electrical wires not tightened by another source, not the installers. I recommend this device to others.
customer_reviews.author: AZpoll

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I certainly like this product a lot. Routines are set for day, night, home, & away. Installation is easy in newer homes (I did my old home in about 20 mins). I had to have professionally installed in my 1949 built current home. The upgraded remote sensor is reliable and stays connected even across the house from the thermostat. App is easy to navigate, though integration with Samsung's SmartThings app is a little clunky (but improving it feels). My one big complaint is the thermostat will struggle to find WiFi on its own if it power cycled; I have to manually tell it to reconnect to the network.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P. Marino

customer_reviews.title: Follow the instructions and you'll be fine
customer_reviews.text: The app has illustrated step-by-step instructions for installing the thermostat. If you're comfortable with a screwdriver, you should be able to install this yourself. I like data, so I was glad to find out that a history of various parameters, including indoor and outdoor temperature and humidity, room occupancy, and heat, cool, and fan statuses are viewable in your account on the web. My utility company is essentially paying me to allow them to dial my HVAC back to balance the grid, and I see this as a win. The only thing that I would complain about is that some Alexa features are not supported, so this thermostat does not fully replace an Amazon Echo.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Full Control
customer_reviews.text: I love the many features of Ecobee. My favorite is the ability to add a pin so I can hear my kids complain when it is too hot instead of them messing with the thermostat. I use this with Flair brand ducts that automatically close and open as needed to keep every room the right temp. This was a huge to help temp control in my one HVAC system, 2 level home. The Flair system interfaces perfectly with Ecobee and is really needed if you have big temperature differences between sections of your home.
customer_reviews.author: P. Dobson

customer_reviews.title: ecobee FTW!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to replace a fairly basic Honeywell thermostat that our HVAC contractor installed with the furnace. This took about 15 minutes for my new HVAC company to install and another 10-15 to get it configured. The battery that came with the remote sensor was a PITA, but eventually got that working as well. The thermostat works well as does the Alexa integration.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bernstein

customer_reviews.title: More difficult to install that expected, but it works like it should ... nice Alexa integration
customer_reviews.text: I needed to install an external 24 Vac wall wart to power my Ecobee since my existing heater wiring did not have a spare conductor to tie the "C" terminal on the heater to the "C" terminal on the ecobee. The documentation that came with the ecobee (And the transformer) was not clear on how to do this so it took a little trial and error. Also, I had to cut a small notch into the trim ring to slip in the 24 Vac power cord from the wall wart since stud bracing made it impossible to conceal the new power feed behind the sheet rock without a major cut and patch. But once installed, the Smart Ecobee works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M.

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: After reading a lot about this thermostat and how it’s compatible with all kinds of systems, I found out this is not true. Support was fast but not what I needed to hear. If you have a Trane system beware! Send their support an email with some picks of your thermostat wires etc before you buy! Only three stars only because of this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P

customer_reviews.title: Finally, I don't have to keep manually fixing temperature deltas.
customer_reviews.text: I'll let others post lofty reviews, I'll just comment on one aspect. Having a remote sensor is fantastic. I've had so much trouble cooling / heating where I'm occupied while the hall is kept at an optimal temperature. Now that I have remote temperature capabilities, and plenty of ways to configure their integration, we're so much more comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B.

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install and works great
customer_reviews.text: I read all instructions and download the app before installing the Ecobee. Installation was easy and straight forward. Syncing to my WiFi and Alexa was simple and effective. I bought two additional room sensors and had all three registered and synced to the Ecobee in less than 10 minutes. Last task was to complete personalizing my schedule. I had the system up and running in a little over an hour. There is significant information on the Ecobee website to fill in any gaps in the written instructions. Specifically, there is good detail about how the system uses multiple inputs to automate keeping my house comfortable while reducing my heating/ cooling costs. Very happy with this purchase. My Ecobee works great!
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: A step in the right direction coming from an Ecobee3
customer_reviews.text: This Ecobee SmartThermostat is a definite upgrade to my trustworthy and reliable Ecobee3. The additional features such as the updated smart sensor, Alexa built in, and premium glass screen add value and function to an already amazing thermostat. I don't even consider it a thermostat. I like to call it me comfort concierge. It works with my original sensors. It knows what rooms are in use. It knows when to change the temperature to try to squeeze in even more savings. It knows how to keep us comfortable in our home better than any other thermostat I have ever used. Highly recommended, even if you are already using an Ecobee thermostat!
customer_reviews.author: JRA

customer_reviews.title: mostly positive
customer_reviews.text: Some weirdnesses with programming. Overall a very good product with some minor need to tweaks. I'd like to have tried the NEST before committing just to compare. Phone app is not very good. Needed firmware update to fix WIFI disconnects. Reminder schedule has a calendar glitch. Still trying to noodle out the vacation schedule and what it does. Biggest benefit comes from remote sensors that offer the system an average of indoor temps. System does not have any adjustment for relative humidity. Hey Ecobee, you need the phone app and online experience to be at least similar (phone app needs a lot of work).
customer_reviews.author: jsumr110

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, all the cords are marked. Alexa works well and the speakers are plenty loud. I’m not a speaker expert but they sound good to me. The app works well and connected with eco+ within a week so I can get a rebate from my energy provider.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K Pfeiffer

customer_reviews.title: Love the detection capability
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of changes for energy efficiency lately and this is one of the best changes I made. The eco sensors detect whether you're home or not and adjust the settings accordingly, even if not within the "scheduled" time frame. This is a relatively new setting on the thermostat which makes a large difference in comfort. The room sensor (comes with one but can purchase more) is a great addition. The WiFi connection and app controls are easy to setup and use. Overall, I would highly recommend the ecobee SmartThermostat for comfort and energy efficiency.
customer_reviews.author: Joan M

customer_reviews.title: Great product, outstanding customer service
customer_reviews.text: I had a small problem installing my Ecobee due to wiring in my furnace. I called Ecobee on a Saturday afternoon and was talking to a well-spoken, very professional, very understandable (I'm sorry, but this matters) technician in about 45 seconds. I almost fell over that I didn't have to call back on Monday or wait on hold for 45 minutes. The tech asked me to send him a pict of my furnace control panel, then talked me through a couple wiring changes to make my Ecobee work perfectly. Just excellent all around. On top of the great service, I'm already very glad I switched from my dumb thermostat to Ecobee after just a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Five ATMs

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I moved into a new house and wanted to upgrade the two thermostats to smart/wifi models. I couldn't decide between Nest and Ecobee. So I wound up buying one of each. Both work fine and both have their pros and cons. From a pure device look/feel and interface; the Nest wins. The Nest app is slightly better except for the schedule module where I like the Ecobee better. The Ecobee comes with a remote sensor which is very nice if you have another room to monitor. I use SmartThings and I believe Ecobee integrates with that which would be another plus. However, I haven't found a reason to do so yet.
customer_reviews.author: gpburdell

customer_reviews.title: Installation should be done by a pro.
customer_reviews.text: Love the Alexa interaction with the ecobee. Easy to install if you use a technician, not so much with DIY. In our case the wires did not match up & as a result we had a $90 service call when we blew a fuse in our heat pump system. We got the bill, our technician got a good laugh. The ecobee keeps our home comfortable. I would and have highly recommend the ecobee. Giving it a 5 star overall. Easy to set up after installation.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Demeyer

customer_reviews.title: Paid for with energy savings in 3 months!
customer_reviews.text: HIGHLY recommend the ecobee. Much better temperature control than a manual program. We set a range and just let it run. It even adjusts automatically when we are gone on the weekends. The remote sensor keeps the whole house temperature even. Best part, our energy bills decreased by at least 25%. This paid for itself in 3 months. Installation was straightforward, but our house has updated wiring. Easy to hook into our energy company savings program too. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: 2 Girls

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve had this for about 3 months. Set up is easy. But requires homework and knowing how to program the sensors. For example. From around 7pm I have it set up to ignore the one in the living room. So that it tracks the bedrooms only for a few hours. The living room is usually cooler. So if I don’t do that. At bed time. The bedrooms would be too hot in the summer. This thing is awesome. Just make sure you take your time to learn your home.
customer_reviews.author: Bloop

customer_reviews.title: Check to see if there are there the necessary number of wires to install the device
customer_reviews.text: The most important thing is to determine beforehand where the necessary connections exist. If so, the installation is relatively easy (relatively, for someone who is accustomed to things like this) otherwise additional wiring may be needed. But I knew that I would love the final result and my Ecobee has not disappointed me. Love it. Love the fact that you can control it through Alexa and all its other features. Check things out before you buy but to make sure you have what you need and you will love it also.
customer_reviews.author: Vazinho

customer_reviews.title: Much better than Nest, especially if you dont have the common wire!!
customer_reviews.text: Had a Nest 3rd before this which claimed to work without the 5th(common) wire. But it started causing my AC to behave weirdly. It would shut off intermittently in middle of cooling cycle. Turns our Nest tries to suck power from where it shouldn't and causes problem with lot of AC units. Ecobee with the included power extension kit fixed the problem and has worked flawlessly so far. Ecobee's remote temp sensors also work a lot better. Nest only allows you to target one sensor at a time with limited scheduling options. Ecobee can aggregate multiple sensors with very flexible scheduling. Keeps the whole house a lot more comfortable!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharad B

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money, high quality in all regards
customer_reviews.text: Was extremely pleased with the step by step instructions. I’ve not done many electrical projects and it made it very simple to do. I got everything correct the first time and total setup time was less than 2 hours with me going very slowly through each step. The unit itself has been great and I really like the extra room sensor and it’s features. The thermostat and the app interface are both great. The sound quality on the thermostat speaker is surprisingly good for music. We have Sonos speakers nearby but sometimes still use the thermostat due to the voice activated ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Ecobee 4 Smart thermostat with voice control
customer_reviews.text: This product is by far the best smart thermostat on the market. The packaging is beyond first class. The install printed, online and You tube videos are excellent- I installed two devices in less than one hour in two separate homes! The voice control I thought would be a gimmick at first, but now I never really touch the device to change a setting- Alexa does it for me! The display is very easy to read and if needed additional information on weather is available via your WiFi connection. Overall, I could not be more satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: E. ONeill

customer_reviews.title: The remote sensors work like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was not super easy, it took a bit of troubleshooting to get it working right. There are just manny ways an HVAC system can be configured. My biggest complaint is the menus can be a bit confusing to navigate to get to the configuration. But overall the system works quite well, I’m going to get additional sensors for the rest of the house. We sleep much better now that the sensor is located in the bedroom and it stays at the desired temp. It’s the primary reason I chose this over Nest, and I have to say it’s 100% worth it
customer_reviews.author: Motoken

customer_reviews.title: Alexa is a bit buggy
customer_reviews.text: This replaces my 3M filtrete Wifi thermostat (one of the first wifi 'stats around back then) and it does the thermostat thing very well. It was a breeze to install, I have a C wire, no big deal. Alexa was easy to configure as well. Alexa is buggy. She just is. I am sure over time this will get better. I have many skills activated and I'm sure this will get even better as I understand the capability of the technology and the IFTTT capability. I have two of these, each one controlling one level HVAC.

customer_reviews.title: Best thermostat out there
customer_reviews.text: Best thermostat out there. I Purchased the ecobee Alexa enabled thermostat it was extremely easy to install and the tech-support is absolutely amazing if needed. I have had a nest and a lyric thermostat.There is no comparison the ecobee wins hands-down in every aspect but it specially with reliability and quick response time to changes.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great but needs some refinement
customer_reviews.text: The graphs for the data are rough. Need some refining for detail and usability. I've had other Wi-Fi thermostats that do a great job showing graphs of the data. The remote sensor needs to have the ability to turn on the fan only to equalize the temperature when there is a large variance in temperature from room to room. The sensors also need to be integrated for motion detection with Alexa routines. Would be awesome if the sensors could be used for zone control of vent baffles.
customer_reviews.author: Strider

customer_reviews.title: Ecobee has broken all integrations and isn’t fixing it.
customer_reviews.text: Ecobee used to have an api that would allow other apps to interact with it, that all changed when they rolled out a new website that broke their OAuth. One star, if they ever fix it this could be a great product but for now don’t rely on anything that needs oauth.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help with the whole home smart technology and I don’t regret a thing. This product is so good, the electric company is offering them at a discounted price to accumulate data that proves these things save you money on heating and cooling costs. Works great with Siri. Absolutely love this. I recommended it to coworkers and they’re buying them too.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Greaves

customer_reviews.title: Up and Running in No Time!
customer_reviews.text: Packaging - simple and effective Instructions - very clear. Follow each step and you'll have no issues Installation - requires minimal skill. need to know where your HVAC breaker is and recommend taking picture of your wire setup prior to removing old thermostat Setup - follow the process; don't skip steps. setup the thermostat and wait for it to prompt you to download the ecobee app. Product - incredibly well designed and user friendly
customer_reviews.author: DannyC

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to zones for older homes
customer_reviews.text: My mid-century forced water system is a bit unbalanced and intended to get some colder rooms and some warmer rooms throughout the house. With this unit and some additional sensors the system seems to be doing a great job balancing things out. I don’t use any of the automation stuff. I just run a standard schedule. But Apple HomeKit integration was easy.
customer_reviews.author: HelperMunkee

customer_reviews.title: Best thermostat out there...
customer_reviews.text: Super easy install. Integration was quick and easy. Love the website, I jump on my laptop and check what's going on and make any changes. App is good also. I like that I can intercom any echo device in the house, and it came in useful when I was home alone and lost my phone. The thermostat called my phone and I found it ! Brilliant ! Speaker is about echo dot quality so I can play music in the hallway if I wanted to. I think it's the best out there right now.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mo

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be better!
customer_reviews.text: Installed for my mother, who is too short to read the old analog version. The device installed easier than I imagined, with no problems whatever. (I did have a C-wire installed previous to the thermostat, which eased the install considerably) She can now see the current temperature by way of the digital display, and can change the setting from her living room chair, through Alexa. Perfect install!
customer_reviews.author: L. Hoefling

customer_reviews.title: Half baked
customer_reviews.text: I bought and used it for last ~4 months now. Alexa integration is iffy, hit or miss. Speaker is weak(2 out of 5), can't drop in or call. 1 extra Sensor is a joke, it runs thru new battery every 3 weeks and reinstall /reconnect is a mess (1 out of 5). Installation was not easy but manageable. Wall unit looks good and responsive.( 4/5). I have stopped using the remote sensor after 2nd month. Documentation of the product in the web seems poor for this very model.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly poor humidifier/dehumidifier control
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this model because it can control a central humidifier, however the software does not allow you to schedule when the humidifier runs or not. (So many bells and whistles, but not that??) So when my heating is scheduled to a minimum at night the humidifier and fan is running the whole time. What would it take for their software developers to add a simple on/off switch for the humidifier for each “Comfort Setting”? Problem solved! Btw. If you try to call tech support, be prepared for a very long wait.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Mixed bag
customer_reviews.text: Works well in some ways. Really really wants to turn on eco-friendly features, and once you do that can't be turned off and you need to call your power company to opt-out? It was very strange. Going to reset mine and not opt into that. I just want to turn my AC or heat on myself thankyou. Controlling the device from Alexa is very hard. I can't just say 'Alexa, turn on cool, 70', it tells me echo bee doesn't understand. The other Alexa stuff works well though.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: love all the features and alex integration
customer_reviews.text: This is great implementation of a smart thermostat. The Alexa integration is really good if you are in the Amazon eco system. The apps on iOS iPhone & iPad are very functional, wish they were more in parity, you can't get all the reporting on the iPhone app, but on iPad you do. Remote control on smartphone is easy with all the apps, as well as on the device, glad they don't hide any of it on the device or on the app. Most of all, I like that I can monitor my usage and really fine tune it to save on energy bill, having the remote sensors really help with that aspect.
customer_reviews.author: crimsnv

customer_reviews.title: Quality build, easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: I love my ecobee. I replaced my old thermostat when I installed a new HVAC system on my house. The ecobee was super easy to install and it looks great on my wall. I have yet to fully explore all the features but the voice command, phone app and Alexa features all work smartly and seamlessly. I was going to buy a Honeywell but my HVAC guy suggested the ecobee. I don't know about tech support because I haven't had to use it yet. I'll update this review when I learn more about the item. I will tell you that the unit is well built and sturdy. Seems like quality craftsmanship. I love the glass panel.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Cafiero

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Working great. We like the extra sensor for a spot we use that’s not near the thermostat. Lots of customization in the daily programming if you want it and was super easy to install. Looks great on the wall. It was just what we were looking for. Using Alexa to turn up or down the thermostat and accessing while away from home are great. No problems so far even after the power goes out for a bit. The only downside is that the wake word can’t be changed but that’s pretty minor for us.
customer_reviews.author: bugout

customer_reviews.title: Must for split level homes on one A/C system!
customer_reviews.text: Used with the sensors to control the temperature where the sensors reside since the thermostat sits on the upper level. Programmed it to ignore the temperature at the thermostat (currently 83 degrees) and reference the temp on the main floor, family room or master bedroom depending on the time of day. Now the A/C barely runs during the day when we're not even home! Just which it could handle separate forced hot air heat and A/C on one thermostat, or least share the sensors across two thermostats.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B.

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat works great!
customer_reviews.text: We love our new Ecobee Thermostat with Alexa integration. First off, it was easy to install by following the manual. Connection to WIFI had no issues and it worked from the get go. We are able to control the thermostat from the Ecobee app or we can also call on Alexa to lower or raise the AC to the temperature you want. Another feature I like is music can be played from the thermostat as well with your amazon music subscription. The Ecobee can also be controlled through the Alexa app as well. So glad we purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Bama

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I do not have a "C" wire so i was very nervous about installing this and put it off for a few days. Well I did it. I followed the instructions for the Power Extend Kit step by step, turned the power back on and it works! Probably took me about a hour and a half, the only reason it took that long is because i was second guessing myself. If you follow the instructions step by step you will have no issues. Very easy to program! Will add more to this as time goes on.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Becker

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my 1980's home with forced air furnace and air conditioning. I had the wrong voltage coming to the thermostat so I had to have a professional come out and correct the wiring. Other than that, no issues. App works great on my phone and it's pretty neat that it will automatically over ride the presets with more comfortable settings if I come home early. It would be nice if it was not so crazy expensive to buy more room sensors.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: stopped working abruptly. very frustrated.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working just like that. There were hiccups and glitches from the beginning with both devices I purchased, but this happened just like that--in the dark of winter- in 30 degree temps. I have sick people in the house and the heat isn;t working and Amazon/EcoBee says-- no. No replacement. What? Are you kidding me? you have an alert message from ecobee for thermostat: Upstairs (XXXX): The thermostats internal temperature sensor isn't working and this device must be replaced. Heating and Cooling will not run until this is corrected.
customer_reviews.author: stacy nowak

customer_reviews.title: Nice Upgrade from A Honeywell
customer_reviews.text: I really like the thermostat, it wasn’t easy to install because I have no “C” wire. However, it did come with a power adaptor. While my husband was out fishing I attached the power adapter to the HVAC circuit board and was able to connect it the thermostats existing wires and it worked beautifully. Low and behold he was in shock when he got home and it was hooked up. Now its a matter of learning how to work it lol..
customer_reviews.author: Casandra George

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat great, sensors great, web interface is tedious
customer_reviews.text: Really like the thermostat and sensors. The web interface is tedious, at least for the scheduling. It takes a lot of "click and wait" to get things set up the way you might want. The way you add an activity to a day takes a lot of effort. Ideally, you could create an activity like "naptime" and assign it a timeframe (2pm-3pm) and assign it to days. Instead and activity simply is a start time, so you have to duplicate effort to add an end time, and there isn't a way to use a day as a template. On the whole, a nice product. Hopefully the web will gain some features and it'll be smooth sailing!
customer_reviews.author: B&V

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is straight up top notch...I needed the Power Extension kit and it was up and running in 10 minutes. The app took some learning but after a day its perfect. Alexa speaker is actually pretty loud and sounds good. Didnt even need to use the cover plate because it covered my old units holes and paint imperfections great. Ill update if I find any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but wouldn't work with Google WiFi mesh
customer_reviews.text: While the product is excellent, it would not work with Google WiFi mesh. I was fortunate to have a redundant Wi-Fi system. It worked instantly with my Netgear Wi-Fi router. My advice: if you have a mesh network double check to make sure the Ecobee will work for you. Also, my thermostat did not have a "C wire" which made it it bit more complex to install. Still, once installed, the product is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Marple

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy being able to adjust my thermostat from anywhere. The alexa works well most of the time but does have errors occasionally. The track me feature is nice and accuracy of following you is a little delayed but it's great that wherever I go in my home the temperature will adjust to my comfort level. The downside of this feature is that when my phone leaves the home the program doesn't know anyone else is home and the temp drops to the away temp. The use of this feature is optional of course. Ultimately this is a great product and I think it's better its competitors. Qualifies for rebate with the power company.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecka

customer_reviews.title: Device good - battery life on sensor terrible.
customer_reviews.text: We had our hvac person install - he did it pretty quickly and without issue. App works fine. The remote sensor battery however is crazy. The company website says they should last 5 years. I am on the third one in 6 months. Plus you have order these on line as I could find not one place locally that stocks them. Two cost about $7. Make sure to get a few so you don’t go nuts at the last minute. Not sure how they can be so off on life span. Update: just over a year and it seems that the remote sensor is no longer working. Apart from eating batteries this is very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Book buyer

customer_reviews.title: Some learning curve
customer_reviews.text: It took me a few days to get used to how the temperature range worked. I'm sure on my old analog thermostat, there was a range above and below the number I set it at. It just had no way to tell me. With this thermostat I can set the temperature at 73 and it will reply that it is set between 71 and 76. I'm sure that cushion is needed to give the heat/air room to recycle.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Rucker

customer_reviews.title: Ecobee
customer_reviews.text: Original review stands; this thermostat is overkill, unless you want to constantly be messing with it. You cannot enter a temperature, but have to mess with a slider button that is imprecise, at best. External sensors are useless, even when the zones are set up correctly. Not sure where they were going with this design, but yikes. Honeywell wifi MUCH better product.
customer_reviews.author: TooOldToRunTina

customer_reviews.title: It works great. Relatively easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Only complaint is the extra sensor only works up to 60 feet away. I wanted to put it in a bedroom that is down the hall from where the Ecobee is installed but that would be more than 60 feet. I bought two (one for each floor of the house). I like them. One allowed me to pair it with Apple HomeKit but I couldn't get the other one to pair with HomeKit. Not a big deal because the Ecobee app allows you to do everything you need to do. All the research showed the Ecobee to be the overall best smart thermostat-all things considered. I'm happy with my purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Merry Jane

customer_reviews.title: Second one was an install challenge but ...
customer_reviews.text: Had installed this for our new HVAC system at our vacation house a year ago and love it. So we decided to buy one for our home, and 20-year-old wiring was our Waterloo. It's working great now, but I did have to have our heating and air guy come in to finish install when Ecobee would not power up. It took the technician about three hours to untangle the problem, but all's well and my advice is do not try to DIY with electrical on an older home.
customer_reviews.author: VandyMom

customer_reviews.title: awesome upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Perfect packaging. I got a bit confused looking at my furnace wiring for installation. Called the 1-800 help number. Within 30 minutes it was installed and functioning. I like having control using my phone. Wish I had 2 more sensors (I'll get them) to better manage the temp in the 4 primary rooms we use. Haven't tried the Alexa integration/functionality yet. Hopefully I'll see some energy saving in the future. Solid purchase
customer_reviews.author: Bradley C. Neideck

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you have a mesh wifi
customer_reviews.text: Alexa integration would be awesome if this device worked with mesh networks. This device always is offline. Google "ecobee WiFi offline". This has been a product defect that had not been fixed. If you use mesh wifi networks do not buy this, if you have multiple ap's do not but this.
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Best Smart Home Device EVER!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! LOVE IT! LOVE IT! The physical/technical part of the setup was crazy simple (even without a c-wire) and the digital portion was even smoother. The remote sensors make all the difference when compared to smart thermostats with only one sensor. I’ve legitimately saved more than 100% of the price tag on my energy bill in just 6 months. Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Increased utility bill - unreliable tech support
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I love technology. I wanted to create a smart home based off of Homekit. This was not the answer. Since purchasing it my utility bill has actually gone up significantly and it doesn't run right. Since I've installed the ecobee my A/C will turn off, then turn back on for about 30 seconds..EVERY SINGLE TIME. I called tech support and it's like they couldn't get it through thier heads what was happening. They kept trying to solve a problem I didn't even have. The tech is there but the support and value are not. I will be replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Great, but doesn’t work for multi room speakers
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this device for everything except one major flaw in my eyes. How does this not work with everywhere speaker group!!!!! It had the perfect placement and but doesn’t work for it. I was under the impression it had full Alexa capabilities and it should at the $250 price tag. Please update it for this feature!!! For everything else I love the item though. Haven’t had it running long so we will have to see on the cost savings.
customer_reviews.author: Colt

customer_reviews.title: As a first foray into a Smart thermostat it's a success!
customer_reviews.text: Install was super easy. Even came with the PEK (Power Extension Kit) that converts 4 wires to 5 for older units. I ended up not needing to use it but I was impressed it was included just in case! So far, I'm still trying to commit to the heating/cooling schedules that really work for our needs. Learning curve aside, the override capabilities on the touch screen and the app are filling in the gaps!
customer_reviews.author: F Rose

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking smart themostat
customer_reviews.text: I had to use the PEK and I panicked as soon as I looked at the control board, I didn't have one set of wires going to the furnace, I had 3 sets. One was for the thermostat, another was for the humidifier and one for the a/c condenser. I had to step back and figure out what wires controlled what device. I did a process of elimination and got it handled. Other than that, setup was easy and I had it dialed in and working fine. The Alexa is nice too
customer_reviews.author: Really, True and Sometimes Right

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best!
customer_reviews.text: Very simple install - the instructions are easy to follow and worked perfectly. I like the Alexa integration since the location of my ecobee allows Alexa to hear me where I would otherwise have to shout or walk closer to the room where I have my Echo Show. The ecobee app works very well - love having the capability to add filter and service reminders. I wished it supported geofencing but I have 3 sensors and they perform perfectly, recognizing when the room is occupied and when it isn't.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: No work-ee
customer_reviews.text: Had a certified HVAC guy (that has the ecobee 3 & made the recommendation to me) try to install ITV& it wouldn’t work. Returned. I had him put my old Honeywell 6000 right back on & I love it bc it’s easy to work.
customer_reviews.author: LovinLife

customer_reviews.title: App requires ecobee server. Server is DOWN again.
customer_reviews.text: Must sign into app to adjust thermostat at 4AM...AND it's not accepting my password. I need to turn down the A/C! App requires ecobee server. Server is DOWN again. Must go down at 4am to main unit. :((
customer_reviews.author: THE ULTIMATE PIZZA MANUAL 2.0 FANTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Does Everything it Says
customer_reviews.text: I very much appreciate this thermostat. I had a smart thermostat from another company and, though I fiddled with it, I could not get it to do what needed to be done. The Eccobee makes the setting relatively painless and it does it! I installed it myself with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: SenecaSailor

customer_reviews.title: Not all that smart...
customer_reviews.text: Would not buy again.. Works okay with alexa. The internal microphone could use loads of improvements. Wifi is continuously dropping out requiring password reentry in order to control from the phone. The device does not adhere well to a 3-8pm schedule and cycles the AC on during peak hours. Tends to lower temperature off schedule. You can't set the time on the device with out updating the timezone on ecobee.com.
customer_reviews.author: jarod steen

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Install required 1 hour of tech support, worked for one hour then failed to supply power to the Ecobee thermostat unit. Customer service did them best but after being unable to solve the problem stoped responding time emails Another hour of tech support and it was still non functional. An installer came out and the unit worked for two hours then failed. This singular Ecobee unit has been a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Burns

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I liked the easy to install power extender. Thermostat works well and easy to access via WiFi. Mobile app works exactly like the tstat display. Default behavior is good and lots of options to suit your needs. (eg about 8 different ways to define Temp Hold period. 2 hours, 4 hours, permanently, until next cycle start time, etc)
customer_reviews.author: CA Guy

product_meta.title: ecobee SmartThermostat with Voice Control, SmartSensor Included, Alexa Built-In
product_meta.description: Style:SmartThermostatThe all-new ecobee SmartThermostat with voice control enhances how you experience comfort by working with a state-of-the-art SmartSensor (included) and brings new meaning to having control of your home thanks to Alexa Built-in. Not only will it help you save energy and reduce the cost of heating and cooling your home, it also provides an easy way to have a lasting impact in the fight against climate change.
feature_bullets: AWARD WINNING: Named “The Best Smart Thermostat” by Tom’s Guide. With a crisp glass finish, vivid touch display, powerful quad-core processor, dual-band Wi-Fi, and far-field voice, it’s a smart thermostat like no other.
SMARTSENSOR: Includes SmartSensor to keep important rooms comfortable by adjusting your thermostat based on occupancy and temperature.

ENERGY SAVINGS: By reducing wasted energy in your home, you could save up to 23% annually on your heating or cooling costs (compared to a hold of 72°F). Plus, the eco+ free software works to further maximize efficiency. You can also see if your purchase qualifies for a rebate at ecobee.com/rebates.
ADVANCED COMFORT: With Alexa Built-in and an intuitive mobile app, you can control your thermostat and home using your voice, phone, tablet, computer, or Apple Watch.
INSTALLATION: Easily install yourself in 45 minutes or less with video walkthroughs and a step-by-step guide on the ecobee app. Our Canada-based support team is also just a call away.
ALEXA BUILT-IN: Consider your life handled with Alexa Built-in. Just ask for the weather, music, Alexa Calling, and more.
INTEGRATIONS: Works in harmony with your favorite smart home systems, including Google Assistant, Apple Home Kit, Alexa, Samsung SmartThings, and IFTTT.
